Skills

Back End

Design

  • Figma
  • Draw.io
  • Illustrator
  • Photoshop

My primary focus is on Front End technologies. I've directed a lot of time to learning sematic HTML and understanding where certain elements are appropriate over others. This appropriate use of semantic elements helps with Search Enginge Optimization, screen readers, and other programs that rely on semantic HTML structure. Another big priority in my Front End work is accessibility. When we don't foucs on accessibility it can make it difficult or impossible for people who have disabilities to use our websites.

These are things we should be thinking about from the very beginning in our design phase. Using Figma has been a major upgrade for my designs. It's also taught me that the design phase is critical to making your life easier down the road. You need a map and knowledge of what to expect. Knowing what functionality is expected, how things should look, and a host of other things are what you want to know at the start. We can create multiple designs, and make descisions such as fonts, colors, layout, image placement, etc. all before we invest time in actually building the product.

The types of design I go for are clean, minimalistic, and aesthetically pleasing. The visuals should be matched by the flow of a page. The document's flow show naturally go from one section to the next, and should make sense to the user. These are always considerations I'm making at each step.

Ilja

Dominik Ilja

About

I started Web Development a couple years after graduating High School. I orginally wanted to make a website to host my guitar lessons. I started with Wordpress and wanted to expand out. My first programming language was C#, but later switched to JavaScript because of it's obvious relavence to web development. From there it's been a clear picture in my head that tech is what I want to be involved with in my life.

I found that I got a lot of pleasure from solving problems, and finally getting everything to come together. Programming has made me more creative, and that through trial, error, and perseverance you can find a solution to the problem you're facing.

Plans

I'm currently working on an HTML course and have plans to release that in the next couple of months. I want to continue familiarizing myself with different technologies. I want to take a deeper dive into Node and databases, with the intention of using those skills to develop an exercise web app. I also want to continue learning more about SEO and optimization for webpages in general.

Contact Me

I enjoy working one on one with you and getting to know your goals and ambitions. If you like what you see feel free to send me an email.
